data.title: Michael Howard: ‘The support we lost can be regained only if we have a broad appeal’
data.meta_description: Voters punished the Conservative Party at the polls. Now it’s time to unite behind a new leader and develop an alternative government to put before the country
data.text:
Last Thursday’s election was a catastrophe for the Conservative Party. And my heart goes out to those hard-working MPs who have lost their seats.

It’s been dubbed the punishment election. And, though it’s no comfort at all, we are not alone in having been punished.

Across Europe those parties that have been in government during the Covid pandemic and the rise in inflation caused by the war in Ukraine have paid a heavy price. In France President Emmanuel Macron’s party finished third in the first round of their parliamentary elections and the ruling Social Democrats in Germany finished third in that country’s elections to the European parliament.

Across the continent, people are dissatisfied and frustrated. They are not as well off as they thought they
